name: Hotel Pommeraye

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hadn’t read much about Hotel Pommeraye before my husband and I stayed there for one night recently and we were pleasantly surprised. It’s a two-star hotel so the rooms are basic (the one we stayed in on the fourth floor had no air conditioning or tea/coffee making facilities) but reasonably sized and clean, and there is a lift. The bed was a bit squishy for our liking, the sink in the bathroom was small, and there was a loud creaky floorboard in our room, but otherwise the room was fine. Free WiFi is available at the hotel but our connection on the fourth floor was a bit patchy.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located with bars, restaurants and shops right outside the door. Look out for the amazing chocolate shop down the road, and beware of the inflated prices at some of the bars in Place Royal. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent (standard continental fare plus a basket of breads and pastries each!) and all the staff we met were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic location, great choice

reviews.text: Our directions from Google Maps said we could drive right onto Rue Boileau from Rue du Calvaire but beware – you can’t! The road is blocked at that end by bollards although you can get to it from the south (I think) and park temporarily outside the hotel for loading. We parked our hire car at the Graslin car park, which is at most a five minute walk away. Overnight parking here is free when staying at the hotel, you just pay for any extra hours your car is there for (before 10pm and after 7am I think, or vice versa).
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in central Nantes - definitely recommend

reviews.text: All in all this is a lovely hotel in a great location.
reviews.title: OK but very noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during our visit to Nantes. The hotel is located in the very centre of the city within walking distance off all the sights.
reviews.title: Excellent, lived up to reviews

reviews.text: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise! Arriving by foot it was easy to find; by car it's difficult so if that's what you plan to do, find out the directions. The location is very good - shops and many main attractions are withing walking distance and tram stop "Commerce" is close by.
reviews.title: A lovely little hotel

reviews.text: Staff at hotel were smiley and polite, the front desk staff spoke English but also bore with me as I spoke the little French that I can and didn't change into English.
reviews.title: Perfect location & very reasonable

reviews.text: The room was bright, clean and suprisingly futuristic. Bed was very comfortable and all bedding crispy clean as was the rest of the room. The furniture was sparse - just the bed, small flat screen tv, no real desk and only a small stool - but as I only needed the room for sleeping it was fine. The room also had a lovely French balcony overlooking the streets. After reading other reviews I was a little bit worried about the street noise but was pleasantly surprised: during the day it was nice to listen to the city sounds, and in the night, even though it was a summer weekend, I was able to sleep with the balcony doors open.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: The bathroom was smallish but ok (shower very good!) but be careful - you can flood the room floor as well because there is no shower curtain or any kind of threshold for that matter.
reviews.title: Spacious room, excellent price

reviews.text: Breakfast room is tiny but I found the buffet very good. The waitress brings you a pot of coffee/tea and a nice little bread basket with baguette, croissant and pain au chocolat. The buffet had different kinds of cheeses and ham, yoghurt, boiled eggs, marmalade, fruit salad and juices.
reviews.title: No frills, but no problems either
Interesting proposal right in the heart of Nantes
reviews.text: When you read about this hotel, its art exhibitions, its green compromise, etc. and you see the very reasonable price for a hotel in the center of Nantes, you expect to find more intentions that realities. Prepare to find yourself wrong.

All the green, art or green-art-design hotels that have popped up in cities like Barcelona or Berlin charge it as a bonus. If you want to be green, pay extra. The Pommeraye demonstrates that you can have a beautiful and conscious hotel and charge a reasonable price. Add a very professional staff, attentive and willing to help, the free parking in a near car park for the night (from 7 pm to 10 am, but it saves you like 10 euros a day. We paid like 4 euros from two full days of parking) and a nice decoration and good bathroom and there is no doubt of where to stay in Nantes.
reviews.title: Central location in a nice part of the city

reviews.text: A caveat. The hotel has no air conditioning. We were lucky and the heat was not too bad. It can be a problem in very hot days. And, about the noise coming from the pedestrian street (singers or guitar players during the day, a shouting drunk in the night...), it can disturb you if you wake out with every noise. If not, it is not a big deal.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.text: Contemporary style hotel in stylish old building. Staff pleasant and helpful. Have stayed here on several occassions.Rooms can be hot in summer as there is no air con. Leaving the window open can be noisy.Nantes appears to be suffering in the present economic climate and sadly is at the moment losing the battle against the ever present graffiti. Beggars and people sleeping rough do not help the image of what is a lovely and interesting city. The Pommeraye is located in an up market part of town with nice stylish shops and Passage Pommeraye close by. Good value for money but as usual the breakfast is expensive for what it is. Far better to sit in a pavement cafe and have breakfast as you watch the city waking.
reviews.title: A great little find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel in the centre of Nantes, close to Commerce. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated, basic but very clean adnd well kept. I would certaily recommend a stay here, EXCELLENT!
reviews.title: Real Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not expecting too much as it wasn't an expensive hotel but were pleasantly surprised. The location was very good and, despite the road closures, we found it easily enough by their directions. The style is "quirky", rooms modern, comfortable and clean. The breakfast was good too with plently of choice. We had good double glazing so could shut out the noise if we wanted but rather enjoyed hearing the hustle and bustle of the street below. The only downside was that we had a mad busker singing right outside which would have driven us up the wall - but we just went out and ate at one of the many good retaurants nearby and he was gone by the time we returned. All in all would go there again - as we may well do as we were impressed with Nantes all round!
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.text: Lovely hotel, friendly staff with English good value and great breakfast
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel for touring the old part of the city and the important sights on foot and for immediate access to great shopping.. There is also a great selection of fine and inexpensive restaurants nearby including Cigale's The rooms are spacious. Beds are very comfortable. Staff are helpful and friendly. Wifi is free and if you drive, there is public parking 150 metres away. There is no safe in the room but reception will hold any valuables if you wish though the hotel appears very secure and safe. For English speakers there is no English TV.. All 56 channels on the 32" flatscreen are in French.. Highly recommended for great value and a central hub.
reviews.title: A little gem..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 days. The hotel is in a pedestrian/shopping area with limited vehicle traffic, the hotel
reviews.title: Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: itself, the location, the room, and the breakfast were all excellent but spoiled by the noise outside in street late at night and early in the morning. If it's warm it would be nice to have the windows open to the street, but then sleeping is difficult. In the daytime we had the windows open to the street and enjoyed some breaks reading and looking out.
reviews.title: Brilliant Location in City Centre

description: In the heart of Nantes, an economic and cultural center, located at the entrance of the Passage Pommeraye, it’s the right hotel for active days and peaceful nights. It offers you serenity in the heart of a bustling city. After a busy day, you will find the peace and quiet you desire in your room, newly decorated in a tasteful combination of sleek, modern lines and colors.
